brandHighlight.data:
Founded in 1994 by Don and Jennifer Hartford, the Hartford Family Winery resides in a French-style chateau in the town of Forestville, in the southwestern Russian River Valley. The winery specializes in small lots of vineyard-designated wines of high personality. The wines are labeled with two distinct marks: Hartford Court for the Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and Hartford for old-vine Zinfandel from the Russian River Valley. In recent years, Hartford Family Winery has produced over 25 single-vineyard wines from discrete vineyard blocks from extraordinary vineyard sites extending from Sta. Rita Hills in California north to Eola-Amity Hills in Oregon.
  
Hartford Family Winery was founded in 1994 as a result of Don and Jennifer Hartford’s appreciation for the wines, the people, and the unique vineyards near their Russian River Valley home. Located in the Sonoma County town of Forestville, the winery is about 15 miles from the cool Pacific Coast.

Making delicious wines of high personality is directly related to the difficult locations of our vineyard sources, the limited production of our bottlings and the varietals we use. “Character through adversity” is an expression that we believe applies to people and grapevines and surviving adversity builds character, and personality, in both.

Hartford Family Winery specializes in making wines from single vineyard sites. In recent vintages we have made about 25 different single vineyard bottlings. Small and low-yielding vineyards deliver expressive and personality-rich wine. Our single vineyard Hartford Court Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays total as few as 93 cases, up to about 800 cases. Likewise, our Hartford Old Vine Zinfandels are produced in small quantities. Our single vineyard wines are highly allocated.

description.data: The Hartford Court Russian River Valley Rosé of Pinot Noir has aromas reminiscent of strawberry, grapefruit, Mandarin orange, white peach along with delicate kiwi and floral hints. The fruit flavors lean towards ruby grapefruit and cranberry with a subtle mineral and refreshing acid component that brings complexity and a food friendly character to the wine. Enjoy our Rosé at cellar temperature (54 ̊ F) for maximum complexity or chilled on a hot summer day as an aperitif.  Pair with fresh fruit: strawberries, watermelon, and peach.Cooked shellfish.  This bottled California rosé is 12.8% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
Built of stone in 1898, La Jota Vineyard Co. has deep roots in Napa Valley’s winemaking history. Today, Winemaker Chris Carpenter produces small quantities of mountain Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc from the winery’s estate La Jota Vineyard and nearby W.S. Keyes Vineyard. The wines capture the intense fruit and mineral complexity of their cool-climate location on Howell Mountain.
  
La Jota Vineyard Co. has deep roots in Napa Valley’s winemaking history. It was W. S. Keyes who planted the first vines on Howell Mountain, back in 1888. Ten years later, and a mile down the road, fellow Howell Mountain pioneer Frederick Hess established the La Jota Vineyard—named after the property’s location on the Mexican land grant Rancho La Jota—and built a stone winery that still stands today. While growing grapes in the nutrient-lean, volcanic soils of these vineyards is a challenge, the rewards are undeniable. Highly concentrated flavors and muscular tannins slowly mature to perfection, while the cool winds, diurnal temperature swings and high altitude keep the grape acids impeccably balanced.

description.data: The W.S. Keyes Merlot from La Jota has received phenomenal acclaim from the critics. Rich, dense and complex this red wine is as serious as they come. This powerful red wine opens with mocha and black cherry while the palate exhibits blackberry, and blueberry pie with volcanic minerality. Pairs with leg of lamb, rich tomato based sauces and grilled vegetables.  This bottled California merlot is 15.1% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This powerful red wine opens with mocha and black cherry while the palate exhibits blackberry, and blueberry pie with volcanic minerality.

brandHighlight.data:
Kendall-Jackson is one of America’s most beloved family-owned and operated wineries. Founded by entrepreneur and visionary Jess Jackson in 1982, and now led by his wife Barbara Banke and the Jackson family, Kendall-Jackson is based in Sonoma County and offers a range of acclaimed wines grown on the family’s estate vineyards along the coastal ridges of California. A leader in sustainable vineyard and winery practices, including water and energy conservation and natural pest control, 100 percent of Kendall-Jackson’s vineyards in California are third party certified by SIP (Sustainable in Practice) and CCSW (Certified California Sustainable Winegrowing). The winery’s seminal wine, the Vintner’s Reserve Chardonnay, has been the #1 selling Chardonnay in America since 1992.
  
Founded in 1982, the Kendall-Jackson story is one of family, quality and stewardship. Eight years after planting chardonnay grapes on his Lake County property, founder, Jess Jackson, and his family set out to make a premium, yet affordable, California wine.
In 1983, Jess sold the first case ever of Vintner’s Reserve Chardonnay at the Oyster Bar at Grand Central Station. That same year, the inaugural vintage of Vintner’s Reserve Chardonnay won the first-ever Platinum Award for an American Chardonnay at The American Wine Competition and was a featured favorite at the Reagan’s White House, dubbed “Nancy’s wine.”
Committed to aging and fermenting wine in French Oak barrels, Jess purchased a stave mill in Northeastern France in 1991, making Kendall-Jackson the only American winery to share ownership in a French stave mill. One year later, Kendall-Jackson Vintner’s Reserve Chardonnay became the #1 selling Chardonnay in America and remains so to this day.

description.data: One of Kendall-Jackson's flagship red wines, the Kendall-Jackson Vintner’s Reserve Syrah California red wine highlights the vivid fruit flavors from the cool coast. Crafted boutique-winery style in small individual lots throughout the winemaking process for flavor distinction. Kendall-Jackson is committed to producing only the finest quality wines from Syrah grapes grown in California. This red wine is made from grapes grown in the cool vineyards of Santa Barbara County. Richly layered with flavors of plum, blackberry, cola and hints of spice followed by velvety, lingering tannins. Pair with sausages, rich stews, grilled lamb and BBQ ribs.  This bottled California syrah is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
For over 25 years, Siduri has specialized in producing cool-climate Pinot Noir from five major appellations along the West Coast, spanning from the Willamette Valley in Oregon, down to California’s Santa Barbara County. Their goal is to produce Pinot Noir that best captures the distinct flavor and character of a given vineyard site. To that end, they specialize in Pinot Noir and source only from vineyards that provide exceptional fruit. Siduri’s philosophy is that wine should be a pleasure to drink and that serious wine and serious fun aren’t mutually exclusive.
  
Siduri, named for the Babylonian goddess of wine, is the result of our founders, Adam Lee and Dianna Novy’s, mutual love of Pinot Noir, and their dream that they could make great wines of their own. They spent years working at small, family-owned wineries and using any and all free time learning everything they could about growing grapes and making wine. In 1994, they released the inaugural vintage of Siduri to critical acclaim. Today, Siduri’s breadth and depth of Pinot Noirs is truly unique. We specialize in cool-climate Pinot Noir, producing single-vineyard designate wines from over twenty exceptional vineyard sites stretching from California’s Santa Barbara County to the Oregon’s Willamette Valley. Our winemaking goal is to produce wine that best captures the distinct flavor and character of a given vineyard site. Whenever possible we let the wine make itself. We do not want to do anything to the wine that isn’t absolutely necessary. We believe in bottling our wines un-filtered and un-fined. In the vast majority of cases we have been able to achieve this, with only a handful being filtered, and none of the Pinot Noirs being fined. We avoid these techniques as we believe they have the potential to strip a wine of its flavor. We believe that the best Pinot Noirs express their origins. But perhaps most importantly, we believe that wine should be a pleasure, that serious wine and serious fun aren’t mutually exclusive. So in our drive to make great Pinot Noir, we ultimately hope for something relatively simple—good wine to be enjoyed with good friends, good family and good food.

description.data: Named after the original crops planted at the site, lemons, oranges and avocados, the Siduri Lemoravo Vineyard Pinot Noir shows a fairly classic Santa Lucia Highlands profile – with loads of concentrated red and black fruits. This red wine drinks very well right out of the gate, but should certainly age for a few years with no problem whatsoever. A classic red wine with concentrated red and black fruits, with hints of dried herbs and earthy , both on the nose and palate. Superb balance, good acidity and a lingering finish with a hint of tannins. Pair with grilled salmon, roast chicken, roasted tomato pasta and lamb sliders. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled California pinot noir is 14.2% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: A classic red wine with concentrated red and black fruits, with hints of dried herbs and earthy , both on the nose and palate. Superb balance, good acidity and a lingering finish with a hint of tannins.

brandHighlight.data:
Maggy Hawk takes inspiration from the beauty of the Anderson Valley. The focus is on the purity of the grape and the natural elegance found within. The Maggy Hawk Vineyard, Skycrest Vineyard and Edmeades Vineyard are tucked away among the valley’s rolling hillsides, surrounded by redwoods. The diversity of the vineyards gives the winemaking team a wealth of characteristics to layer into the Maggy Hawk wines. Each has its own style and story to tell. Together, they offer a unique view of this remote region.
  
At Maggy Hawk, our purpose is to craft exceptional Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. We take inspiration from the beauty of our Anderson Valley estate vineyards while continuing to seek out cool-climate sites. We focus on the purity of the grape, and the natural elegance found within.

description.data: Afleet is a blend of three unique blocks of pinot noir from the Maggy Hawk Vineyard in Anderson Valley. After fermentation and aging for 15 months in 25% new French oak, the individual blocks of red wine are blended together and finished unfined and unfiltered. With exceptional breadth, depth, and personality, Afleet pinot noir red wine has lifted floral notes and pleasantly rustic tannins. Orange blossom and jasmine meld with honeydew, passionfruit, and candied apple aromas. An earthy, juicy mid-palate leads into a smooth and silky finish with lovely acidity. Pair with duck breast, roast chicken, mushroom risotto and lamb sliders.  This bottled California pinot noir is 13.8% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
The seeds for Alcance were planted back in the early 1990s in Chile’s then unknown Maule region. While most of the country’s wineries were congregated in the warmer areas to the north, Jess Jackson and Randy Ullom believed this remote, cool-climate region located 155 miles south of Santiago was capable of producing wines of great depth, balance, character and complexity. Time has proven them prescient.

Alcance wines are comprised of three valleys in south of Chile, each with diverse soils and climates – Maule Valley, Maipo Valley and Itata Valley. The varieties produced by Alcance are planted in their optimal soil and sun setting, and come from mature blocks farmed for low yields. After hand sorting, the fruit is fermented in small lots to preserve the essence of the terroir and provide more options when creating final blends. Under the supervision of Chilean winemaker Andres Sanchez and American winemaster Randy Ullom, Alcance produces a Chardonnay, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Carmenère for the Gran Reserva label. As well as two high-tier wines, VIGNO (old-vine Carignan) and Bravura, which showcase the elevation of Chile’s winegrowing regions full potential.

description.data: 100% Carignan varietal, this wine is an ode the Vigno Association of Chile that focuses on promoting Carignan from old, historic bush vines. Our Vigno wine is made from Carignan vines that are between 50-70 years old and is aged for a minimum of two years. This red wine expresses a Mediterranean character with a nose of dry wild flowers, violets and boysenberries. Very expressive tannins with bright acidity make this wine truly distinguishable. Pair with roasted pork, beef stew and duck leg.  This bottled Chile carignan is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This red wine expresses a Mediterranean character with a nose of dry wild flowers, violets and boysenberries. Very expressive tannins with bright acidity make this wine truly distinguishable.

brandHighlight.data:
Lokoya is a collection of four distinct Cabernet Sauvignons from four of Napa Valley’s most celebrated mountain appellations: Mount Veeder, Howell Mountain, Spring Mountain and Diamond Mountain. These limited-production wines are 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, fermented with native yeast, and bottled unfined and unfiltered, resulting in the purest expression of place.
  
Established in 1995, Lokoya is a collection of four distinct Cabernet Sauvignons from four of Napa Valley’s most celebrated mountain appellations: Mount Veeder, Howell Mountain, Spring Mountain and Diamond Mountain. These limited-production wines are 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, fermented with native yeast, and bottled unfined and unfiltered, resulting in the purest expression of place. Cabernet Sauvignon as lens, site as conveyor—the grape variety and winemaking for the four wines remain constant, allowing the vineyard sites to shine with the climate, soils and sunlight all fully expressed in the glass. Given the high elevation of the sites, the vineyards demand constant attention. The deep understanding of the vineyard trajectory in each vintage comes from Winemaker Christopher Carpenter’s years of expertise. Intervention is kept to a minimum both in the vineyard and in the cellar, leaving the fruit to express itself as naturally and eloquently as possible.

description.data: The wines of Lokoya are crafted to express the purest sense of place. This wine is made from high elevation vineyards located in the Spring Mountain District and expresses the signature floral perfume, deep red fruit and smooth tannins this region is known for. Pair with grilled ribeye, rack of lamb and osso bucco.  This bottled California cabernet sauvignon is 15% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
From deep in the heart of Knights Valley, Anakota personifies the rustic elegance and spirit of Sonoma County. Located in an ancient volcanic zone, this relatively untouched and unknown place offers incredibly unique and diverse soils with a climate perfectly suited to Bordeaux varietals. Anakota produces two single-vineyard Cabernet Sauvignons from the winery’s estate vineyards: Helena Dakota and Helena Montana, as well as a blended Knights Valley Cabernet Sauvignon.
  
The story of Anakota begins deep in the heart of the Knights Valley AVA in rural Sonoma County. Knights Valley AVA is a remote winegrowing region bridging Sonoma and Napa Counties, set along the flanks and foothills of Mount St. Helena and the Mayacamas Mountains. Located in an ancient volcanic zone, this rustic sanctuary possesses the sparse volcanic soils and cusp maritime climate needed to produce elegant, profound and age-worthy Cabernet Sauvignons. Under the direction of Vigneron Pierre Seillan, we produce small quantities of single-vineyard Cabernet Sauvignons from our two hillside estate vineyards: Helena Dakota and Helena Montana. 


As stewards of the land, we consciously design our vineyards to have minimal impact of the surrounding environment. The majority of acreage on our Knights Valley estate are left unplanted, which encourages biodiversity and sustained ecosystems. In return, the message of the soil is preserved and vines are nourished with true authenticity of the land. We are also actively engaged in stream restoration and protecting endangered species to keep the land healthy and vibrant.

description.data: Helena Montana single-vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon chronicles the terroir at its steep, hillside site in Knights Valley AVA in Sonoma County. It is a deeply concentrated and elegant wine, characterized by its lush, velvety opulence that shows well in its youth but will expand and improve with age. This red wine has a concentrated, deep red color with aromas of blackberries, currants, violets, chocolate, spice and licorice. The palate offers deep, expansive flavors supported by soft, silky tannins. Pair with rich foods such as steak, venison, short ribs and lamb chops.  This bottled California cabernet sauvignon is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This red wine has a concentrated, deep red color with aromas of blackberries, currants, violets, chocolate, spice and licorice. The palate offers deep, expansive flavors supported by soft, silky tannins.

brandHighlight.data:
Established in 2008, Captûre is inspired by California's frontier spirit while staying true to time-honored French winemaking traditions. Rooted in the far reaches of the Mayacamas Mountains, Captûre is dedicated to the remote, high elevation vineyards of Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak – a unique AVA that straddles Sonoma and Mendocino counties. Along the untamed edges of mainstream winegrowing, Captûre winemaker Sam Teakle focuses on high altitude expressions of Sauvignon Blanc and Cabernet Sauvignon.
  
Captûre brings classic Bordeaux-style winemaking to the rugged Mayacamas Mountains in Northern California’s wine country. This volcanic range runs 52 miles southeast from Mendocino County, shearing through Lake, Sonoma and Napa Counties on its way. These mountains are rich in winegrowing history; winemaking dates back to the 1860s in these mountains.

Established in 2008, Captûre is inspired by California’s frontier spirit while staying true to time-honored French winemaking traditions. Its origins are rooted in the far reaches of the Mayacamas Mountains. Captûre seeks out remote, high elevation vineyards within Alexander Valley, Knights Valley, Spring Mountain District and Lake County—appellations at the untamed edges of mainstream winegrowing, where wildlife is seen more than human visitors. With elevations up to 2,400 feet, conditions here are tough for the vines. Thin topsoil forces the roots to burrow down deep into the rock to search for water and nutrients, producing wines rich in character, complexity and elegance.

Winemaker Sam Teakle is tasked with crafting the wines, finding the top vineyard sources and developing the Pine Mountain estate vineyard. For Captûre, Sam is creating a style that is true to himself and true to the brand, showcasing mountain Sauvignon Blanc and Cabernet Sauvignon from the Mayacamas Range.

description.data: A unique red wine blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc from Spring Mountain District that is aged for 18 months in 100% French oak barrels, 45% new. This red wine offers a nose of lavender and dried flowers, and a palate of chocolate and both red and black fruits, with a round, juicy mid-palate and a lingering finish. Pair with lamb burgers, roast quail, mushroom ragu and hard cheeses.  This bottled California red blend is 15.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This red wine offers a nose of lavender and dried flowers, and a palate of chocolate and both red and black fruits, with a round, juicy mid-palate and a lingering finish.

brandHighlight.data:
Nielson is guided by the pioneering spirit of their namesake, Uriel J. Nielson, who planted the first commercial vineyard in California’s Santa Barbara County in 1964. The Pinot Noir and Chardonnay express the purity, freshness and vibrancy of Santa Barbara County, and the screwcap closure makes these wines adventure-ready, wherever the road less traveled takes you.
  
We are guided by the pioneering spirit of our namesake, Uriel J. Nielson, who planted Santa Barbara’s first commercial vineyard in 1964. This underdog wine region is unpretentious, yet meticulous, and home to pioneers and adventurers who are driven by the love of the vine. The Nielson Vineyard in Santa Barbara County’s Santa Maria Valley is our home and represents the legacy of boldness, risk-taking and experimentation embraced by our founders and carried on by our winemaking team today. At the core of our DNA is our proximity to the Pacific Ocean. Coastal wind patterns, marine soils, morning fog and seaside sunsets make Santa Barbara the perfect setting for uncommon wines of stunning minerality, acidity and balance. At Nielson, we employ small lot winemaking techniques such as hand pruning, block-by-block harvesting, barrel fermentations and lees stirring to create wines that beg discovery.

description.data: The Santa Maria Valley Chardonnay is completely barrel fermented and goes through 100% malolactic fermentation with use of native yeasts. The resulting wine is complex with clear fruit expression and bright acidity. Signature Santa Maria Valley aromas of tropical fruit are present on this white wine, paired with a slightly saline minerality. Peach and citrus come across on the palate, with a long, clean finish. Pair with caser salads, fish tacos and lemon roasted chicken. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled California chardonnay is 13.9% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Signature Santa Maria Valley aromas of tropical fruit are present on this white wine, paired with a slightly saline minerality. Peach and citrus come across on the palate, with a long, clean finish.

brandHighlight.data:
Cambria Estate Winery is one of Santa Maria Valley and Santa Barbara County’s most iconic, storied wineries dating back to 1986 when it was founded by wine icon Jess Jackson and his wife Barbara Banke. Today, the winery remains family-owned and operated, with daughters Katie (Katherine) and Julia Jackson serving as co-proprietors. The winery produces exceptional Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays that are the truest expression of its single-vineyard sourcing from its eponymous Julia’s Vineyard and Katherine’s Vineyard. Every wine bearing the Cambria name is 100% sustainably grown and produced on the estate.
  
Cambria Estate sits on storied land. Originally planted in 1971, and brought into the Jackson family by Jess Jackson and his wife Barbara Banke in 1986, Cambria’s land has been a premier producer of cool climate wines for more than 45 years. Situated on one of the only transverse valleys on the West Coast, Cambria’s vineyards are planted on the Santa Maria Bench where cool, sea air funnels in unobstructed from the nearby Pacific Ocean, blanketing the vines in maritime fog. With one of the longest growing seasons in California, the unique climate at the Estate produces “refrigerated sunshine” that develops concentrated flavors in the grapes making Cambria ideally situated for cultivating Chardonnay and Pinot Noir varietals.

Every Cambria wine produced is a single vineyard offering. The two primary vineyards on the Estate are Julia’s and Katherine’s. Named for Jess and Barbara’s daughters, these vineyards are marked by depth of character, and a history of acclaim – most recently when Wine Spectator named the 2017 Katherine’s Vineyard Chardonnay one of the Top 100 Wines of 2019. Each vineyard holds within it ancient Soils that include 14 different soil types, while each block contributes different flavor and structural qualities to the wines. Additionally, the 17 clonal varietals on the property are a study in diversity. With a commitment to craftsmanship and artistry, winemaker Jill Russell and the tremendous winemaking and vineyard teams bring to life the legacy of this land through each wine.

brandHighlight.data:
Crowded House produces wines that capture the very essence of Marlborough, New Zealand, with vibrant and fresh aromatics, powerful fruit concentration, and a refreshing, cleansing acid finish. The fruit is sourced from exceptional vineyard sites and simply steered in the right direction to retain fruit purity and best express the vibrant fruit flavors that Marlborough is renowned for while respecting the subtle differences of each site.
  
When we started Crowded House we were either brave or silly. And amongst the only ones in the region. Now we share the valley with many others, it’s what this place Marlborough was created for.
Today our philosophy is simple. We produce wines that capture the very essence of Marlborough, with vibrant and fresh aromatics, powerful fruit concentration and a refreshing, cleansing acid finish. Once harvested, our role is to simply steer the fruit in the right direction in order to best express the vibrant fruit flavors that Marlborough is renowned for while respecting the subtle differences of each site. These wines are about fruit purity, and our aim is for them to be equally enjoyable to drink by themselves amongst friends, as they are paired with a variety of foods.

description.data: True to the Crowded House style, the Sauvignon Blanc wine is quintessentially Marlborough, vibrant, fresh and cleansing with a lovely precise framework carrying the fruit flavors to a long, pure and mouthwatering finish. It peaks aromatically for the first two years of its life. The gentle acidity ensures early drinking will be a pleasure. This white wine displays citrus with tropical and stone fruit flavors and herbs. The palate is vibrant and fresh with a lovely structure carrying the fruit flavors to a long, mouthwatering finish. Pairs well with herbs and greens, shellfish, goat cheese, fried appetizers. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled New Zealand sauvignon blanc is 12.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This white wine displays citrus with tropical and stone fruit flavors and herbs. The palate is vibrant and fresh with a lovely structure carrying the fruit flavors to a long, mouthwatering finish.

brandHighlight.data:
In 1998, Lynn and Ron Penner-Ash founded Penner-Ash Wine Cellars in the northern Willamette Valley’s Yamhill-Carlton AVA. Bringing to life their shared vision, through years of hard work unyielding commitment, the pair built a reputation for lush, layered Pinot Noir and community leadership throughout the valley. With Founding Winemaker Lynn Penner-Ash and Winemaker Kate Ayres at the helm, today the winery continues to source from premier vineyards across the Willamette Valley’s sub-AVAs, grounded in decades-long relationships with grower neighbors and friends.
  
In 1998, Lynn and Ron Penner-Ash founded Penner-Ash Wine Cellars in the Northern Willamette Valley’s Yamhill-Carlton AVA. The pair built their LIVE certified sustainable gravity-flow winery surrounded by an 11-acre Estate Vineyard. The building seems to spring from the land itself – a reflection of the values, spirit and winemaking philosophy of Penner-Ash. The wines reflect the Willamette Valley’s distinct textures, flavors and terroir, with beautiful elegance and balance. Decades-long relationships with grower neighbors and friends provide access to fruit from the region’s most distinguished vineyards, including Shea Vineyard, Bramble Hill Vineyard, and Zena Crown Vineyard. Grounded in these partnerships, filled with respect and admiration for this land, Penner-Ash Pinot Noirs are lush and inviting – a textural experience from start to finish. 

Lynn Penner-Ash began her career in the Willamette Valley with Rex Hill Vineyards in 1988, becoming the first woman winemaker hired on Oregon. As a pioneer in the Willamette Valley, Lynn built the foundation of her legacy as a ‘master blender’ of the Willamette Valley AVA, and an early champion of the region’s promise. Today, she works side by side with Winemaker Kate Ayres, who has been entrusted to carry forward the longstanding relationships with grower neighbors and friends that Lynn has fostered over the past twenty years. In the winery, Lynn and Kate focus on small-lot indigenous yeast fermentation with extended cold soaks to extract a rich, fruit-focused, textured mouth feel. Each lot is vinified separately then artistically crafted into single vineyard wines, as well as blended to create the flagship Penner-Ash wine, the Willamette Valley Pinot Noir.

description.data: Our Willamette Valley Pinot Noir is our flagship wine, sourced from the region's most distinguished vineyards. These eminent sites produce a terroir driven Pinot Noir that showcases unique textures and flavor profiles characteristics. brandHighlight.data:
Arrowood specializes in Cabernet Sauvignon producing the highest-quality, Bordeaux-inspired wines for more than 30 years. Founded by legendary Sonoma winemaker Richard Arrowood in 1986, Arrowood centers its focus around three signature appellations of Sonoma County – Sonoma Valley, Alexander Valley and Knights Valley – considered premier regions for Cabernet. Led today by winemaker Kristina Shideler, Arrowood continues its pioneering legacy as a benchmark for Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon.
  
Arrowood is Sonoma County’s Cabernet Sauvignon specialist, crafting Bordeaux inspired blends from Sonoma’s most distinguished vineyards for over thirty years. In keeping with the vision of our legendary founder and Sonoma County native, Richard Arrowood, we continue to seek out the most distinctive sites for each variety’s expression within Sonoma County.

Our experience has allowed us to identify three AVAs within Sonoma County where Cabernet Sauvignon takes on its most powerful, terroir-driven expressions: Knights Valley, Alexander Valley, and Sonoma Valley.

Winemaker and expert blender, Kristina Shideler, uses the distinctive qualities of each of AVA to craft the most complete and complex Cabernet blends possible, from the prized Reserve Speciale to the delightful, by-the-glass Sonoma Estates. Kristina, who joined Arrowood in 2015, developed her passion for Bordeaux varietals as well as her intimate understanding of Sonoma’s mountain Cabernet belt, during her time at Vérité and Stonestreet Estate.

description.data: The Arrowood Prowess Red Blend is the truest expression of its vintage, with each year’s release containing different combinations of the five Bordeaux varietals sourced from Arrowood’s top vineyard sites. Each year winemaker, Kristina Shideler, strives to create the most complete and complex red wine possible outside the bounds of a single varietal. This means that the blending process can often go through over twenty iterations before the ultimate blend is selected for optimal structure, texture and finish. This red wine exhibits layered aromas of red and dark fruit, with savory undertones of slate, nutmeg and white pepper. It’s structured with classic appeal and complexity that evolves on the palate. Pair with Tomahawk steak, rack of lamb, venison and hard aged cheeses.  This bottled California red blend is 14.6% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This red wine exhibits layered aromas of red and dark fruit, with savory undertones of slate, nutmeg and white pepper. It’s structured with classic appeal and complexity that evolves on the palate.

brandHighlight.data:
For over 25 years, Siduri has specialized in producing cool-climate Pinot Noir from five major appellations along the West Coast, spanning from the Willamette Valley in Oregon, down to California’s Santa Barbara County. Their goal is to produce Pinot Noir that best captures the distinct flavor and character of a given vineyard site. To that end, they specialize in Pinot Noir and source only from vineyards that provide exceptional fruit. Siduri’s philosophy is that wine should be a pleasure to drink and that serious wine and serious fun aren’t mutually exclusive.
  
Siduri, named for the Babylonian goddess of wine, is the result of our founders, Adam Lee and Dianna Novy’s, mutual love of Pinot Noir, and their dream that they could make great wines of their own. They spent years working at small, family-owned wineries and using any and all free time learning everything they could about growing grapes and making wine. In 1994, they released the inaugural vintage of Siduri to critical acclaim. Today, Siduri’s breadth and depth of Pinot Noirs is truly unique. We specialize in cool-climate Pinot Noir, producing single-vineyard designate wines from over twenty exceptional vineyard sites stretching from California’s Santa Barbara County to the Oregon’s Willamette Valley. Our winemaking goal is to produce wine that best captures the distinct flavor and character of a given vineyard site. Whenever possible we let the wine make itself. We do not want to do anything to the wine that isn’t absolutely necessary. We believe in bottling our wines un-filtered and un-fined. In the vast majority of cases we have been able to achieve this, with only a handful being filtered, and none of the Pinot Noirs being fined. We avoid these techniques as we believe they have the potential to strip a wine of its flavor. We believe that the best Pinot Noirs express their origins. But perhaps most importantly, we believe that wine should be a pleasure, that serious wine and serious fun aren’t mutually exclusive. So in our drive to make great Pinot Noir, we ultimately hope for something relatively simple—good wine to be enjoyed with good friends, good family and good food.

brandHighlight.data:
Passion for wine with a sense of place is what defines WillaKenzie Estate, located in the heart of Oregon’s Willamette Valley. Named after the sedimentary soil on which the vines are planted, preservation of the local ecosystem is at the forefront of WillaKenzie’s winemaking practices. The signature of the is its range of benches, ridgelines, elevations, slopes, exposures, and clonal plantings, making it one of the most diverse estates in the Willamette Valley.
  
WillaKenzie Estate is located in the Yamhill-Carlton sub-AVA in the Northern Willamette Valley, Oregon. The winery was established in 1991 by Bernard Lacroute, who was inspired by the Estate’s dynamic rolling hills that reminded him of his Burgundian roots. The Estate is named for the marine sedimentary soil series on which the vineyard is planted, in keeping with tradition that great wines reflect a true sense of place. WillaKenzie remains committed to its sustainable practices by preserving the biodiversity of the land and is Oregon’s first LIVE certified winery (#001).

brandHighlight.data:
Established in 2008, Captûre is inspired by California's frontier spirit while staying true to time-honored French winemaking traditions. Rooted in the far reaches of the Mayacamas Mountains, Captûre is dedicated to the remote, high elevation vineyards of Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak – a unique AVA that straddles Sonoma and Mendocino counties. Along the untamed edges of mainstream winegrowing, Captûre winemaker Sam Teakle focuses on high altitude expressions of Sauvignon Blanc and Cabernet Sauvignon.
  
Captûre brings classic Bordeaux-style winemaking to the rugged Mayacamas Mountains in Northern California’s wine country. This volcanic range runs 52 miles southeast from Mendocino County, shearing through Lake, Sonoma and Napa Counties on its way. These mountains are rich in winegrowing history; winemaking dates back to the 1860s in these mountains.

Established in 2008, Captûre is inspired by California’s frontier spirit while staying true to time-honored French winemaking traditions. Its origins are rooted in the far reaches of the Mayacamas Mountains. Captûre seeks out remote, high elevation vineyards within Alexander Valley, Knights Valley, Spring Mountain District and Lake County—appellations at the untamed edges of mainstream winegrowing, where wildlife is seen more than human visitors. With elevations up to 2,400 feet, conditions here are tough for the vines. Thin topsoil forces the roots to burrow down deep into the rock to search for water and nutrients, producing wines rich in character, complexity and elegance.

Winemaker Sam Teakle is tasked with crafting the wines, finding the top vineyard sources and developing the Pine Mountain estate vineyard. For Captûre, Sam is creating a style that is true to himself and true to the brand, showcasing mountain Sauvignon Blanc and Cabernet Sauvignon from the Mayacamas Range.

description.data: Our flagship wine Tradition is a bright and fruit forward representation of a classic Sauvignon Blanc white wine, produced from grapes grown in Sonoma and Lake counties in Northern California. The purity of the fruit is elevated through stainless steel fermentation and eight months of sur lie aging. This white wine exhibits citrus, white stone fruit and green apple fragrances, finishing with vivid acidity and minerality. Pair with raw oysters, mussels and white fish ceviche. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled California sauvignon blanc is 13.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
Kendall-Jackson is one of America’s most beloved family-owned and operated wineries. Founded by entrepreneur and visionary Jess Jackson in 1982, and now led by his wife Barbara Banke and the Jackson family, Kendall-Jackson is based in Sonoma County and offers a range of acclaimed wines grown on the family’s estate vineyards along the coastal ridges of California. A leader in sustainable vineyard and winery practices, including water and energy conservation and natural pest control, 100 percent of Kendall-Jackson’s vineyards in California are third party certified by SIP (Sustainable in Practice) and CCSW (Certified California Sustainable Winegrowing). The winery’s seminal wine, the Vintner’s Reserve Chardonnay, has been the #1 selling Chardonnay in America since 1992.
  
Founded in 1982, the Kendall-Jackson story is one of family, quality and stewardship. Eight years after planting chardonnay grapes on his Lake County property, founder, Jess Jackson, and his family set out to make a premium, yet affordable, California wine.
In 1983, Jess sold the first case ever of Vintner’s Reserve Chardonnay at the Oyster Bar at Grand Central Station. That same year, the inaugural vintage of Vintner’s Reserve Chardonnay won the first-ever Platinum Award for an American Chardonnay at The American Wine Competition and was a featured favorite at the Reagan’s White House, dubbed “Nancy’s wine.”
Committed to aging and fermenting wine in French Oak barrels, Jess purchased a stave mill in Northeastern France in 1991, making Kendall-Jackson the only American winery to share ownership in a French stave mill. One year later, Kendall-Jackson Vintner’s Reserve Chardonnay became the #1 selling Chardonnay in America and remains so to this day.

brandHighlight.data:
Stonestreet was established in 1995 with the vision to defy the limits of California winegrowing. With a focus on mountain viticulture and ageworthy expressions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Chardonnay, winemaker Graham Weerts brings global expertise and more than two decades of experience at the estate to Stonestreet’s high elevation vineyards. Climbing into the Mayacamas Mountains in Sonoma County’s Alexander Valley, the vineyards range from 400 to 2,400 feet in elevation, yielding powerful wines that reflect the extreme landscape of the mountain.
  
Stonestreet Estate Vineyards stands as one of the most extensive mountain estates in the world and is a testament to the quality of high-elevation winegrowing in California. Here one finds a collection of distinctive single vineyard Cabernet Sauvignons, Chardonnays and Sauvignon Blancs—wines carved from an extreme landscape.

Stonestreet Estate Vineyards is a story of one man’s vision to defy the limits of California winegrowing. Purchased in 1995 by Jess Jackson and Barbara Banke, Stonestreet Estate Vineyard sits in the eastern portion of the Alexander Valley AVA in Sonoma County. Climbing from 400 to 2,400 feet above sea level, Stonestreet Estate is a patchwork of peaks, valleys and ridges defined by high elevations, volcanic soils and cool maritime breezes. 

From these divergent terroirs, Stonestreet Estate crafts site-specific single vineyard wines. Additionally, the Stonestreet portfolio showcases an Estate Cabernet Sauvignon, Estate Chardonnay and Estate Sauvignon Blanc—a collection of expressive cuvees originating from the most highly prized vineyard blocks on the mountain during a given vintage.

description.data: Rockfall Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon red wine is one of our most dramatic vineyard locations, situated above the fog-line at 2,200 feet elevation. Mountaintop sun exposure imparts textural depth and richness to the wines, and a uniquely complex formation of bedrock under the vineyard contributes to the wine’s distinctive minerality. Planted vertically up the steep slope with a 30% grade and positioned to face south, we refer to this block as the ‘solar panel’ for the abundant sunshine it receives. This red wine exhibits aromas of dark fruit and chocolate, with hints of mulling spices and peppercorn. The savory palate has hints of blueberry and tobacco, balanced by a structured tannin profile. Pair with grilled dry aged ribeye with mushrooms, lamb, and braised beef short ribs  This bottled California cabernet sauvignon is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This red wine exhibits aromas of dark fruit and chocolate, with hints of mulling spices and peppercorn. The savory palate has hints of blueberry and tobacco, balanced by a structured tannin profile.

brandHighlight.data:
Lokoya is a collection of four distinct Cabernet Sauvignons from four of Napa Valley’s most celebrated mountain appellations: Mount Veeder, Howell Mountain, Spring Mountain and Diamond Mountain. These limited-production wines are 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, fermented with native yeast, and bottled unfined and unfiltered, resulting in the purest expression of place.
  
Established in 1995, Lokoya is a collection of four distinct Cabernet Sauvignons from four of Napa Valley’s most celebrated mountain appellations: Mount Veeder, Howell Mountain, Spring Mountain and Diamond Mountain. These limited-production wines are 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, fermented with native yeast, and bottled unfined and unfiltered, resulting in the purest expression of place. Cabernet Sauvignon as lens, site as conveyor—the grape variety and winemaking for the four wines remain constant, allowing the vineyard sites to shine with the climate, soils and sunlight all fully expressed in the glass. Given the high elevation of the sites, the vineyards demand constant attention. The deep understanding of the vineyard trajectory in each vintage comes from Winemaker Christopher Carpenter’s years of expertise. Intervention is kept to a minimum both in the vineyard and in the cellar, leaving the fruit to express itself as naturally and eloquently as possible.

description.data: The wines of Lokoya are crafted to express the purest sense of place. This wine is made from high elevation vineyards located atop Howell Mountain and possesses deep, concentrated flavor combined with this region’s unique minerality and earthy tones. description.data: Pleinair presents our interpretation of Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon. The name refers to the French painters' method of painting outdoors (en plein air), which developed around the same time as Napa's first European-style vineyards in the 1800s.Grapes for this wine come from throughout the valley’s diverse soils and micro-climates; careful blending brings complexity and depth to the wine’s rich black fruit, spice, and floral notes—all supported with balanced acidity and a firm tannin structure. brandHighlight.data:
The original name, La Crema Viñera, means “best of the vine,” setting the winery standard since 1979. The family-owned and operated winery is focused exclusively on cool-climate appellations, from its original home in the Russian River Valley, to Monterey and Oregon’s Willamette Valley. The winemaking team is continually exploring these very special regions—passionate in the belief that they make uniquely expressive and elegant wines. Vineyard site selection and boutique winemaking techniques ensure the consistently distinct, naturally balanced wines we are committed to producing. The La Crema Estate is nestled within the storied Saralee’s Vineyard in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Here, the winery has created a premier destination for unparalleled wine education and culinary explorations.
  
La Crema began at a time in the 1970’s during which few wineries in California were making Pinot Noir, and even fewer were doing so with a single-vineyard focus. From the start, La Crema was inspired by Burgundian-style Chardonnay and Pinot Noir with a focus on small lot production that nurtured distinct flavors and balance of unique wine growing regions. 

Initially, La Crema focused efforts on developing wines from the Sonoma Coast, deemed the next great appellation for Pinot Noir, using artisan, boutique-style production techniques, like gentle handling, precision sorting, and crushing grapes in small batches.

At La Crema, excellence in the bottle begins in the vineyard. The year 2019 marked La Crema’s 40th anniversary—fittingly its “ruby” year of eliciting the very best of the vine. This success is as much about the winery’s vision and commitment to quality winemaking which is rooted in the vineyards and soil.

As La Crema looks to the future, it will continue to focus on cool-climate Burgundian-style wines and produce appellation-specific and single-vineyard bottlings from exceptional sites in California and Oregon.

description.data: Sourced from one of California's most prestigious wine-growing regions, the La Crema Russian River Valley Chardonnay is a rich, textured, and refined white wine with balanced acidity and a lush finish. This Chardonnay captures the timeless elegance of California's Russian River Valley, with aromas and flavors of orchard fruit, citrus, and vanilla. A richly textured white wine with aromas and flavors of citrus blossom, apple, nectarine, lemon meringue pie and caramel. Bright acidity balances the richness through a lingering finish. Pair with wild salmon, bone-in pork chop, seared Ahi and roast chicken.  This bottled California chardonnay is 14.2% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: A richly textured white wine with aromas and flavors of citrus blossom, apple, nectarine, lemon meringue pie and caramel. Bright acidity balances the richness through a lingering finish.

brandHighlight.data:
Established in 2008, Captûre is inspired by California's frontier spirit while staying true to time-honored French winemaking traditions. Rooted in the far reaches of the Mayacamas Mountains, Captûre is dedicated to the remote, high elevation vineyards of Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak – a unique AVA that straddles Sonoma and Mendocino counties. Along the untamed edges of mainstream winegrowing, Captûre winemaker Sam Teakle focuses on high altitude expressions of Sauvignon Blanc and Cabernet Sauvignon.
  
Captûre brings classic Bordeaux-style winemaking to the rugged Mayacamas Mountains in Northern California’s wine country. This volcanic range runs 52 miles southeast from Mendocino County, shearing through Lake, Sonoma and Napa Counties on its way. These mountains are rich in winegrowing history; winemaking dates back to the 1860s in these mountains.

Established in 2008, Captûre is inspired by California’s frontier spirit while staying true to time-honored French winemaking traditions. Its origins are rooted in the far reaches of the Mayacamas Mountains. Captûre seeks out remote, high elevation vineyards within Alexander Valley, Knights Valley, Spring Mountain District and Lake County—appellations at the untamed edges of mainstream winegrowing, where wildlife is seen more than human visitors. With elevations up to 2,400 feet, conditions here are tough for the vines. Thin topsoil forces the roots to burrow down deep into the rock to search for water and nutrients, producing wines rich in character, complexity and elegance.

Winemaker Sam Teakle is tasked with crafting the wines, finding the top vineyard sources and developing the Pine Mountain estate vineyard. For Captûre, Sam is creating a style that is true to himself and true to the brand, showcasing mountain Sauvignon Blanc and Cabernet Sauvignon from the Mayacamas Range.

description.data: The Capture Innovant Red Blend is a perfectly balanced red wine blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot from the mountains of Alexander Valley in Sonoma County. To add luscious texture and complexity, this California read wine is aged for 21 months in 100% French oak, with 50% new barrels. This red wine offers aromas of blue fruits, cola and dusty red raspberry. Flavors of savory spices harmonize with a silky mouthfeel and long tannins while mountain fruit complement the bright acidity. Pair with lamb burgers, roast quail, mushroom ragu and hard cheeses.  This bottled California red blend is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
Freemark Abbey is one of Napa Valley’s original Cabernet houses. With a legacy that dates to 1886, it was established as the region’s 16th bonded winery by Josephine Tychson, one of the first female vintners in California. Today, the winery is celebrated for crafting classically structured Cabernet Sauvignon and Chardonnay from pedigreed sites in the Rutherford AVA, particularly the iconic Bosché and Sycamore vineyards. As one of the first wineries in the Napa Valley to establish a wine library, Freemark Abbey possesses one of the country’s most extensive wine cellars, underscoring the quality and of longevity of its admired Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon.
  
With a winemaking legacy dating to 1886, Freemark Abbey is one of Napa Valley’s original Cabernet Houses. The winery’s rich heritage and pedigreed approach to winemaking in Rutherford cement Freemark Abbey as an enduring beacon of quality and tradition that spans multiple generations.

Freemark Abbey dates back to 1881, when Josephine and John Tychson purchased 147 acres in the Napa Valley. Eight decades later, Freemark Abbey helped launch the modern era of California wine.

In the 1960s and early 1970s, the Bosché Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon, known as Cabernet Bosché, was considered one of the most iconic bottlings in the United States and the Chardonnay proved that California could produce world-class wines from this noble variety. Freemark Abbey was one of 12 American wineries chosen to compete in the historic Judgment of Paris tasting in 1976. It was the only producer with entries in both the Cabernet and the Chardonnay flights.

Today, the portfolio is comprised of an impressive collection. The winery showcases single vineyard designate wines from the prestigious Rutherford AVA, including the iconic Bosché and Sycamore Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignons.

description.data: The Freemark Abbey Napa Valley Merlot red wine represents the Napa Valleys natural ability to perfect Bordeaux varieties. The vineyards range from deep gravelly valley floor to high elevation mountainous volcanic soils. The depth of fruit coupled with the richness of flavor provides a profile that delivers from the initial sip. Aromas and flavors of cherries, wild strawberry and blueberry cobbler jump from this glass of this ruby-colored red wine. The spicy oak is well integrated with smooth flavors of baking spice, leather and plum. Pair with camembert and parmesan cheeses, pasta with bolognese sauce, beef bourguignon.  This bottled California merlot is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Aromas and flavors of cherries, wild strawberry and blueberry cobbler jump from this glass of this ruby-colored red wine. The spicy oak is well integrated with smooth flavors of baking spice, leather and plum.

brandHighlight.data:
Arrowood specializes in Cabernet Sauvignon producing the highest-quality, Bordeaux-inspired wines for more than 30 years. Founded by legendary Sonoma winemaker Richard Arrowood in 1986, Arrowood centers its focus around three signature appellations of Sonoma County – Sonoma Valley, Alexander Valley and Knights Valley – considered premier regions for Cabernet. Led today by winemaker Kristina Shideler, Arrowood continues its pioneering legacy as a benchmark for Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon.
  
Arrowood is Sonoma County’s Cabernet Sauvignon specialist, crafting Bordeaux inspired blends from Sonoma’s most distinguished vineyards for over thirty years. In keeping with the vision of our legendary founder and Sonoma County native, Richard Arrowood, we continue to seek out the most distinctive sites for each variety’s expression within Sonoma County.

Our experience has allowed us to identify three AVAs within Sonoma County where Cabernet Sauvignon takes on its most powerful, terroir-driven expressions: Knights Valley, Alexander Valley, and Sonoma Valley.

Winemaker and expert blender, Kristina Shideler, uses the distinctive qualities of each of AVA to craft the most complete and complex Cabernet blends possible, from the prized Reserve Speciale to the delightful, by-the-glass Sonoma Estates. Kristina, who joined Arrowood in 2015, developed her passion for Bordeaux varietals as well as her intimate understanding of Sonoma’s mountain Cabernet belt, during her time at Vérité and Stonestreet Estate.

description.data: The Sonoma Estates Cabernet Sauvignon is a bright and juicy red wine with a plush and velvety texture. The grapes are sourced from select sites throughout Sonoma County's top regions for Cabernet: Sonoma Valley, Knights Valley, and Alexander Valley AVAs. This red wine is readily enjoyable on its own and versatile enough to be paired with anything from casual pub fare to a classic ribeye. A bright and juicy red wine with a plush texture, layered aromas of black cherry and ripe berries. Ripe fruit character carries through on the palate along with undertones of caramel and cedar. Pair with grilled steak, lamb sliders, rack of lamb and sugo sauce. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled California cabernet sauvignon is 14.5% alcohol by volume. One 375ml bottle is equivalent to 2.5 glasses of wine.

tastingNotesText.data: A bright and juicy red wine with a plush texture, layered aromas of black cherry and ripe berries. Ripe fruit character carries through on the palate along with undertones of caramel and cedar.

brandHighlight.data:
Founded in 1994 by Don and Jennifer Hartford, the Hartford Family Winery resides in a French-style chateau in the town of Forestville, in the southwestern Russian River Valley. The winery specializes in small lots of vineyard-designated wines of high personality. The wines are labeled with two distinct marks: Hartford Court for the Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and Hartford for old-vine Zinfandel from the Russian River Valley. In recent years, Hartford Family Winery has produced over 25 single-vineyard wines from discrete vineyard blocks from extraordinary vineyard sites extending from Sta. Rita Hills in California north to Eola-Amity Hills in Oregon.
  
Hartford Family Winery was founded in 1994 as a result of Don and Jennifer Hartford’s appreciation for the wines, the people, and the unique vineyards near their Russian River Valley home. Located in the Sonoma County town of Forestville, the winery is about 15 miles from the cool Pacific Coast.

Making delicious wines of high personality is directly related to the difficult locations of our vineyard sources, the limited production of our bottlings and the varietals we use. “Character through adversity” is an expression that we believe applies to people and grapevines and surviving adversity builds character, and personality, in both.

Hartford Family Winery specializes in making wines from single vineyard sites. In recent vintages we have made about 25 different single vineyard bottlings. Small and low-yielding vineyards deliver expressive and personality-rich wine. Our single vineyard Hartford Court Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays total as few as 93 cases, up to about 800 cases. Likewise, our Hartford Old Vine Zinfandels are produced in small quantities. Our single vineyard wines are highly allocated.

description.data: The Hartford Court Dina’s Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel shows deep, dark color along with focused ripe blackberry, floral and anise aromas that transition into cocoa, blackberry and blueberry flavors. The dense, tannin structure of the wine is balanced by high fruit intensity and bright acidity, making it a wine that shows well today and will age and improve for years to come. The floral and anise aromas of this red wine transition into cocoa, blackberry and blueberry flavors. The dense, tannin structure of the wine is balanced by high fruit intensity and bright acidity. Pair with grilled meats and smoked meats, poultry and tomato based pastas.  This bottled California zinfandel is 14.9% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: The floral and anise aromas of this red wine transition into cocoa, blackberry and blueberry flavors. The dense, tannin structure of the wine is balanced by high fruit intensity and bright acidity.

brandHighlight.data:
Stonestreet was established in 1995 with the vision to defy the limits of California winegrowing. With a focus on mountain viticulture and ageworthy expressions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Chardonnay, winemaker Graham Weerts brings global expertise and more than two decades of experience at the estate to Stonestreet’s high elevation vineyards. Climbing into the Mayacamas Mountains in Sonoma County’s Alexander Valley, the vineyards range from 400 to 2,400 feet in elevation, yielding powerful wines that reflect the extreme landscape of the mountain.
  
Stonestreet Estate Vineyards stands as one of the most extensive mountain estates in the world and is a testament to the quality of high-elevation winegrowing in California. Here one finds a collection of distinctive single vineyard Cabernet Sauvignons, Chardonnays and Sauvignon Blancs—wines carved from an extreme landscape.

Stonestreet Estate Vineyards is a story of one man’s vision to defy the limits of California winegrowing. Purchased in 1995 by Jess Jackson and Barbara Banke, Stonestreet Estate Vineyard sits in the eastern portion of the Alexander Valley AVA in Sonoma County. Climbing from 400 to 2,400 feet above sea level, Stonestreet Estate is a patchwork of peaks, valleys and ridges defined by high elevations, volcanic soils and cool maritime breezes. 

From these divergent terroirs, Stonestreet Estate crafts site-specific single vineyard wines. Additionally, the Stonestreet portfolio showcases an Estate Cabernet Sauvignon, Estate Chardonnay and Estate Sauvignon Blanc—a collection of expressive cuvees originating from the most highly prized vineyard blocks on the mountain during a given vintage.

description.data: The Stonestreet Upper Barn Chardonnay white wine is our most transporting Chardonnay, from an exquisite site situated at 1,800 feet elevation in the Alexander Valley. The texture is both opulent and elegant, exhibiting the delicacy of fruit and quartz-like transparency that only improves with age. This white wine is extremely well-integrated with a lingering, mouthwatering, and round finish that begs another sip. This white wine showcases aromas of lilies, pear and lemon custard, with flavors of tropical fruit, caramel, and a savory note. Well-integrated fruit with a lingering, mouthwatering rounded finish. Pair with grilled halibut or sea bass with a citrus vinaigrette, scallops and risotto.  This bottled California chardonnay is 14.1% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This white wine showcases aromas of lilies, pear and lemon custard, with flavors of tropical fruit, caramel, and a savory note. Well-integrated fruit with a lingering, mouthwatering rounded finish.

brandHighlight.data:
diatom specializes in only one variety—Chardonnay—and is motivated by the pursuit of subtraction and refinement. Sourced from Santa Barbara County, Winemaker Greg Brewer describes his work with diatom as “…the polishing of a grain of rice until one has reached its ultimate inner core.” Fermented at low temperatures in small stainless-steel tanks, coupled with inhibited malolactic fermentation and short hose transportation, diatom pays homage to the stark maritime influenced landscape of its provenance. Greg Brewer strives to imbue recognition of place with as little disturbance, distraction or interference as possible. The resulting wine has a sense of transparency and a purity of intent and purpose.
  
“Diatom is motivated by the pursuit of subtraction and refinement. It is the polishing of a grain of rice until one has reached its ultimate inner core. Our Sta. Rita Hills marine landscape is stark and so are the wines of its provenance. We strive for a recognition of place with as little disturbance, distraction or interference as possible. The resulting wines have a sense of transparency and a purity of intent and purpose.” —Greg Brewer, Founder & Winemaker

description.data: Fermented at low temperatures in small stainless-steel tanks, coupled with inhibited malolactic fermentation and short hose transportation, diatom intends to capture Chardonnay in its most raw, carnal state. This white wine has aromas of citrus blossom and mineral with accenting flavors of green apple and lime. The saline and precise texture carry through the balanced finish. Pair with seafood like ceviche, oysters and crab. Poultry as well.  This bottled California chardonnay is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
Cambria Estate Winery is one of Santa Maria Valley and Santa Barbara County’s most iconic, storied wineries dating back to 1986 when it was founded by wine icon Jess Jackson and his wife Barbara Banke. Today, the winery remains family-owned and operated, with daughters Katie (Katherine) and Julia Jackson serving as co-proprietors. The winery produces exceptional Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays that are the truest expression of its single-vineyard sourcing from its eponymous Julia’s Vineyard and Katherine’s Vineyard. Every wine bearing the Cambria name is 100% sustainably grown and produced on the estate.
  
Cambria Estate sits on storied land. Originally planted in 1971, and brought into the Jackson family by Jess Jackson and his wife Barbara Banke in 1986, Cambria’s land has been a premier producer of cool climate wines for more than 45 years. Situated on one of the only transverse valleys on the West Coast, Cambria’s vineyards are planted on the Santa Maria Bench where cool, sea air funnels in unobstructed from the nearby Pacific Ocean, blanketing the vines in maritime fog. With one of the longest growing seasons in California, the unique climate at the Estate produces “refrigerated sunshine” that develops concentrated flavors in the grapes making Cambria ideally situated for cultivating Chardonnay and Pinot Noir varietals.

Every Cambria wine produced is a single vineyard offering. The two primary vineyards on the Estate are Julia’s and Katherine’s. Named for Jess and Barbara’s daughters, these vineyards are marked by depth of character, and a history of acclaim – most recently when Wine Spectator named the 2017 Katherine’s Vineyard Chardonnay one of the Top 100 Wines of 2019. Each vineyard holds within it ancient Soils that include 14 different soil types, while each block contributes different flavor and structural qualities to the wines. Additionally, the 17 clonal varietals on the property are a study in diversity. With a commitment to craftsmanship and artistry, winemaker Jill Russell and the tremendous winemaking and vineyard teams bring to life the legacy of this land through each wine.

description.data: The Clone 4 pinot noir grapes were sourced from Cambria's Julia’s Vineyard, where the vines were planted using grafting material from the original Clone 4 established on the property in 1970. The vines are well-established and consistently produce classic Pommard style wines with a distinctive expression unique to the Santa Maria Valley. Ripe red fruit with exotic spice aromas and flavors, are the dominate characters in this silky, lingering red wine. Underlying earthiness and dried orange peel are displayed in the mid-palate. Pizza with sausage, mushroom and roasted peppers.  This bottled California pinot noir is 14.4% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Ripe red fruit with exotic spice aromas and flavors, are the dominate characters in this silky, lingering red wine. Underlying earthiness and dried orange peel are displayed in the mid-palate.

brandHighlight.data:
Located in the Bennett Valley sub-region of Sonoma County, Matanzas Creek Winery earned its reputation as a pioneer for Sauvignon Blanc and Merlot in the 1970s. The winery's estate vineyards in Sonoma County are sustainably farmed, extending from the cool coastline to the inland valley and producing a diversity of expressions of its celebrated Sauvignon Blanc and Merlot wines. Beyond the widespread recognition of the wines, Matanzas Creek is famous for its stunning lavender gardens.
  
With four decades of winemaking heritage, Matanzas Creek’s expertise in Sauvignon Blanc dates to the beginning, when founding winemaker Merry Edwards developed her signature style. The winery has a rich history of industry leadership, including launching the careers of many renowned California winemakers, producing pioneering research on clonal significance, and spearheading the founding of the Bennett Valley AVA. Since its start in 1977, Matanzas Creek has left an indelible mark on the California wine industry.

Today, the aromatic expertise of winemaker Marcia Torres-Forno, experience in Chile, Napa, and Sonoma, shines through in each bottle. Achieving the signature delicacy in all of Matanzas Creek’s wines requires strict attention to detail. Timing of the pick in the vineyards is determined by grape hue signaling aromas of the fruit, which are then cultivated in the cellar with careful selection of fermentation vessel types. 

Matanzas Creek wines are sourced from the optimal growing sites for each offering. The wines are always crafted to express a profound sense of place, and delicately woven into the portfolio with a common thread of simple elegance.

description.data: From Matanzas Creek, one of Sonoma County’s most esteemed wineries, comes a new Chardonnay. Lively & savory, it promises to delight both our devoted supporters and those yet to experience Matanzas Creek. The chardonnay vineyards used in this blend are sourced from all over Sonoma County, from high elevation vineyards above Alexander Valley that bring tension and power, to Bennett Valley where cooler growing conditions allow flavors to develop that are crisp and vibrant. Crafted to exemplify an expression of the fruit, this white wine has aromas and flavors of grilled nectarine and white lilies with hints of pineapple and key lime pie. Minerality balances this elegant wine. Pair with butternut squash and ricotta ravioli, seared salmon with farro salad, and roasted chiken with wild mushrooms and herb couscous.  This bottled California chardonnay is 13.7% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Crafted to exemplify an expression of the fruit, this white wine has aromas and flavors of grilled nectarine and white lilies with hints of pineapple and key lime pie. Minerality balances this elegant wine.

description.data: Three Thieves Rosé Wine shows a pale pink hue in the glass, while the nose brims with aromas of white peach and apricot. To ensure freshness and vibrant crispness, the winemakers fermented this wine entirely in stainless steel tanks with no malolactic fermentation nor oak aging. Pair this California rosé with a veggie pizza, light spring pesto pasta or with hummus and flatbread. One 750mL bottle of Three Thieves Rosé Wine has 12.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: AMERICA'S #1 ALCOHOL REMOVED WINE! When you—or your guests—opt not to drink alcohol, Fre delivers a refined alternative to blasé sodas and flavored water. We craft our delicious, alcohol-removed wines for everyday enjoyment, whether you’re relaxing on the couch mid-week or hosting an elegant baby shower. Every sip of Fre reflects California’s acclaimed wine regions. We make our wine using traditional methods, then we carefully remove the alcohol, while preserving the wine’s delicate flavors. The result is the perfect wine experience—without the alcohol.

description.data: With its effervescent fizz in the glass, FRE Alcohol-Removed Sparkling Brut Wine is an alcohol removed wine that makes any occasion special. Cascades of tiny bubbles release a wonderfully fresh, fragrant aroma of green apples and ripe pears with a hint of peach. The crisp, fruity apple and strawberry flavors display a balance of acidity and residual sweetness with a dry, refreshing finish, inviting a second glass. FRE Brut Sparkling Alcohol-Removed Wine is not only a perfect toasting and celebration beverage, it also complements appetizers, fish and poultry dishes, spicy Asian cuisines and light desserts. The grapes for this non-alcoholic wine are sourced from California vineyards, where breezes and fog allow the grapes to ripen slowly and develop rich, complex flavors. FRE wine is crafted using traditional winemaking methods, followed by state-of-the-art spinning cone technology to remove the alcohol while safeguarding the delicate aromas and flavors of a traditional glass of wine. This four-pack of canned wine has less than 0.5% alcohol by volume and half the calories of regular wine. FRE is America's #1 alcohol-removed wine.

brandHighlight.data: In a corner of the world steeped in heritage, yet unrestrained by convention, Taken crafts their wine entirely from Napa Valley fruit. They view this traditional region through a decidedly of-the-moment lens, capturing the unmatched terroir of Napa as an ever-evolving narrative. A story of flavor, complexity and depth.

description.data: Taken Red Blend is a careful balancing act of light and dark. At first glance, the nose is dominated by ripe notes of raspberry, blackberry, black currant, and plum, but careful consideration reveals soft, floral undertones. Delicate hints of jasmine and vanilla bean elevate the palate while the body is defined by flavors of quince, roasted fig, and extra dark chocolate with a dash of allspice. This Napa Valley red wine received 91 points for the 2018 vintage from James Suckling in 2021. Aged 4 months in 25% Oak (86% French, 7% American, 7% Hungarian). This red wine pairs well with lasagna, bolognese and tomato-based pasta dishes. This bottle of wine has 14.3% ABV.

brandHighlight.data: Bandit Wines was created by Charles Bieler and Joel Gott—who partnered in 2003 to bring their passion for great wine and their thirst for exploration together in a convenient, easy-to-tote package. Bandit’s design for Tetra Pak© make it an adventure-ready drink that stays fresh and uses natural resources responsibly. A proud supporter of the National Park Foundation, Bandit features custom illustrated images of America’s iconic National Parks on each package. #ExploreWithBandit

description.data: Bandit Cabernet Sauvignon Wine is a rich, layered dry red wine that comes in an eco-friendly recyclable wine box. Black cherry and toasted oak aromas in this red wine Cabernet Sauvignon reveal blackberry, cherry and black currant flavors wrapped in subtle vanilla and spice. Bandit Wines is a 1% for the Planet member and donates 1% of sales back to environmental nonprofits. Pair this Cabernet wine with a juicy burger topped with blue cheese or grilled steaks. The wine has toasty, robust oak characteristics and undergoes full malolactic fermentation for a rich, velvety texture. The red wine was aged in French and American oak. Bandit wine comes in a lightweight container with a twist-to-open cap, so there's no need to worry about a corkscrew. The container reseals easily to keep the remaining wine fresh so you can enjoy it again later. This 500mL Tetra Pak of wine contains approximately three glasses of Cabernet Sauvignon wine. This dry California red wine has 13.8% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
"A wine inspired by the true story of thousands of 19th century free travelers who willingly journeyed by sea from London to the far side of the world in 1886. Instead they arrived at Port Misery, South Australia…a dark swamp like place of lawlessness, low morals and high vice, far from the promising new beginnings they sought. At that moment they thought, if HOPE had brought them here, to this dismal place, then surely this was ‘Hopes End.”  And so it was named.

Among these free travelers was a young doctor, who had the remarkable idea to make a new kind of tonic for his patients, wine.  With this new idea came new beginnings, so in that moment they stopped always hoping for a better tomorrow and decided to live for the day.

HOPES END is named for the place where our wine began, in South Australia 1886. Our wine’s journey also begins in HOPE, with the bright sunlight of our hot South Australian summers and the purity of our vines and grapes."

description.data: Hopes End Red Wine Blend is a voluptuous red blend that abounds in vibrancy and finishes with a dark heady swoon. Composed of 49% Shiraz, 30% Grenache, 14% Malbec and 7% Petit Verdot, this dry red wine showcases blueberry pie, truffle and mocha flavors with spicy aged tones. The finish is soft and tantalizing from the brandy tempered oak. Hopes End Red Blend 2017 Vintage received 92 points and "Great Value" from the Tasting Panel; try the latest release. This Australian red wine is a great complement to a variety of foods, including brisket, roast and pizza. Hopes End's vines grow strong and robust in the heartland of South Australia’s vineyard regions. Bright, warm summers and deep sandy loam over limestone soils ensure vines flourish to produce intensely flavored, perfectly ripened grapes. Hopes End Red Blend is aged for 30 days in barrels previously used to mature Australia's most awarded brandy. This bottled wine has 13.5% alcohol by volume. A true story that began with hope and ended with wine. Hopes End pays tribute to the free settlers who have travelled to South Australia in search of a better life.

brandHighlight.data: Renowned winemaker Charles Smith and Charles Bieler launched a joint venture with a Washington-grown rosé inspired by Bieler's Provençal roots, ultimately kick-starting the American rosé movement. Charles & Charles is about two guys turning Washington’s old-school dirt and New World fruit into a true original. They’ve been at it for over a decade now, crafting wines that still honor the terroir of Columbia Valley.

description.data: Charles & Charles Malbec Red Wine shows depth and precision. This incredibly focused Malbec leads with oodles of black fruit and spice layered over a present yet supple structure and a lingering thread of barrel toast and mocha. Rosemary accents that build richness toward polished tannins. This red wine received 92 points from Wine Spectator and 93 points from Wine Enthusiast in 2020. This Malbec is a great match for steak, pork and fattier fish like salmon. The single-vineyard Malbec comes entirely from the Northridge Vineyard which is the highest elevation spot in the Wahluke Slope. A collaboration between famed vintners Charles Bieler and Charles Smith, Charles & Charles wines express the beauty and power of Washington State. This bottled wine has 14.8% alcohol by volume.

description.data: The Thieves appreciate a bold, juicy Red Wine Blend — so they decided to create a wine that would dazzle taste buds on every sip. Bright cherry aromas leads to a good medium-weighted palate with strong berry fruit and hints of vanilla. The sweet toasty oak flavors linger slightly for a smooth, satisfying finish. Enhanced with French and American oak. Good medium-weighted palate with strong berry and cherry fruit, and toasty sweet oak flavors. Approachable and enjoyable in style, this wine embodies the classic California vibe. Rated Top 100 Best Buys by Wine Enthusiast. brandHighlight.data: Renowned winemaker Charles Smith and Charles Bieler launched a joint venture with a Washington-grown rosé inspired by Bieler's Provençal roots, ultimately kick-starting the American rosé movement. Charles & Charles is about two guys turning Washington’s old-school dirt and New World fruit into a true original. They’ve been at it for over a decade now, crafting wines that still honor the terroir of Columbia Valley.

description.data: Power meets finesse with this juicy and refreshing Charles & Charles Chardonnay White Wine. This full-flavored dry white wine offers aromas of Pippin apples, pear and citrus with exotic fruit and toast. Featuring a flinty, gun smoke aromatic component, this Chardonnay wine is decadent on the palate without being heavy, balanced by an element of flint and minerality. This white wine Chardonnay earned 88 points from Wine Spectator. Pair a bottle of this Chardonnay with asiago and havarti cheese or pesto pasta, or sip it on its own to unwind at the end of the day. All of the fruit for this white wine was grown in the Columbia Valley AVA from three principal vineyards: Evergreen/Ancient Lakes, Shaw High River and Moxee. Over 20% of this dry wine is barrel-fermented and aged for a touch more barrel influence, while the remaining wine is fermented and aged in stainless steel. This bottled wine has 13.9% alcohol by volume. Charles & Charles wines express the beauty and power of Washington State.
